events.title: Assassination of John F. Kennedy
events.description: John F. Kennedy, the 35th President of the United States, was assassinated while riding in a motorcade in Dallas, Texas.
events.significance: This event shocked the world and led to major changes in U.S. security protocols and policies. It also marked a pivotal moment in American history and triggered numerous conspiracy theories.

events.title: Death of Blackbeard the Pirate
events.description: Edward Teach, better known as Blackbeard, was killed in a battle with British naval forces off the coast of North Carolina.
events.significance: Blackbeard was one of the most notorious pirates of the Golden Age of Piracy, and his death marked a significant point in efforts to suppress piracy.

events.title: Tehran Conference begins
events.description: Winston Churchill, Franklin D. Roosevelt, and Joseph Stalin met for the first time to discuss military strategy against Nazi Germany and post-war plans.
events.significance: This conference was crucial in coordinating the Allied war effort and planning for the post-war world order.

events.title: Vasco da Gama departs Lisbon for India
events.description: Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama set sail on his expedition to find a sea route to India, eventually linking Europe and Asia via ocean.
events.significance: This voyage opened up direct maritime trade between Europe and Asia, reshaping the global economy and beginning a new era of overseas colonialism.
